Game

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • Game.MoveableCharacter
            • Game.Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FireAttack, Heart, Player

    public abstract class Sprite
extends MoveableCharacter
    This class represents a sprite animation character.
    It handles the changing of the Sprite's costumes.
    Author:
    Sitton
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        private static final java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> existingSprites
        An ArrayList containing all the existing Sprite instances

      • costumeConst

        protected int costumeConst
        The costume constant of the Sprite.
        The images of the sprite are divided to rows and columns. Each two rows represents the same type of image, but looking to the other direction. Therefore, the costumeConst determines which type of the sprite images needs to be used:
        0 - first and second rows
        2 - third and fourth rows
        4 - fifth and sixth rows
        etc...

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(int x,
              int y,
              java.lang.String url,
              int rows,
              int columns,
              int wantedWidth,
              int wantedHeight,
              int speedX,
              int speedY)
        This constructs a new Sprite with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        x - - the starting location of the Sprite on the x axis
        y - - the starting location of the Sprite on the y axis
        url - - the url location of the image of the sprite
        rows - - the number of rows in the sprite image
        columns - - the number of rows in the sprite image
        wantedWidth - - the desired width of the Sprite
        wantedHeight - - the desired height of the Sprite
        speedX - - the speed of the Sprite on the x axis
        speedY - - the speed of the Sprite on the y axis

        wantedWidth - - the desired width of the Sprite
        wantedHeight - - the desired height of the Sprite
        speedX - - the speed of the Sprite on the x axis
        speedY - - the speed of the Sprite on the y axis

    • Method Detail

      • handlePictures

        private void handlePictures(javax.swing.ImageIcon imageIcon)
        This method cuts the sprite image in the right places (by rows and columns) and saves it in the COSTUMES field which represent the individual images of the character.
        Parameters:
        imageIcon - - the original sprite image

      • moveToLocation

        public void moveToLocation(int newX,
                           int newY)
        This method moves the MoveableCharacter to the target (x,y) position.

        In addition, it updates the currentColumn and currentRow fields of the Sprite in order to fit to the correct costume of the movement.
        Overrides:
        moveToLocation in class MoveableCharacter
        Parameters:
        newX - - the desired x location to the MoveableCharacter to be at
        newY - - the desired y location to the MoveableCharacter to be at
        See Also:
        COSTUMES

      • getNextColumn

        public int getNextColumn()
        This method returns the next column of the sprite image (if the current column is the last column in the image, than it will return the first column)
        Returns:
        - the column after the current column in the sprite's image

      • isLookingRight

        public boolean isLookingRight()
        Returns:
        the isLookingRight field's value - true if looking right and false if not

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws the Sprite using its currentRow and currentColumn fields, and its current x and y position values
        Specified by:
        draw in class MoveableCharacter

        public java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> spritesTouching()
        returns an ArrayList containing all the Sprite instances that are currently touching the Sprite this method ran on
        Returns:
        - an ArrayList containing all the Sprites touching my sprite
